Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is

You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top, a pair of mystic
purple suede clogs, a stretchy long-sleeved light purple top with a brightly
colored star print, a pair of tight white denim jeans with a small dark-red 'XX'
embroidered on the back left pocket, a lilac satin push-up bra, and a pair of
soft lilac satin bikini panties here.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average, naturally
shaped breasts with prominent rosy nipples. Her abdomen is attractive and
punctuated by a cute navel. More intimately, she has soft pale honey blonde
pubic hair and a girlish butt. Her face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose
and understated chin. Her lips are lovely and blush pink and occasionally part
to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are
blue-green and almond-shaped. Her waist-length, straight hair is pale honey
blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval
pink fingernails.
A small enameled crimson dragon pierces her belly button, a small enameled
cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing nothing. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer
bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells
around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring
engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple
amethyst crystals, and an elegant white gold ring inset with a perfect solitaire
diamond. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both shoulders, chest, back, both
biceps, both elbows, abdomen, both forearms, both wrists, both hands, waist,
both hips, groin, both thighs, both knees, both calves, both ankles, and both
feet are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

undress into suit

cuddle lily

who cesar

help aces
--
Star Conquest Help: Aces and Veterans
--
Category: Background
--
In Star Conquest, we have a few levels of pilots beyond your standard pilot.
* Ace pilots are well known by most, if not all pilots in the leagues, and their
actions have been recorded in the annals of history, such that anyone with a
vested interest in the pilot leagues would know of their deeds.
* Veteran pilots transcend the ace classification, in that they tend to be
'larger than life'. A veteran pilot tends to be well known in popular (non-pilot
and otherwise) culture, and more often than not have holovids detailing their
exploits.
Obtaining ace or veteran status is handled primarily ingame, through one's
character's actions, although in some cases it can also be obtained through a
special application in character generation.
The following is a listing of current and former (player character) pilots
holding ace or veteran status.
AEU:
* Ather Jammoa: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Phoenix Burst (Medal), Accord of Free Worlds Meritorious
Service Medal, Aria Star (Medal)
    Achievements: Defense of New Earth, Defense of United Stations of the Accord
* Sean Dillon: Retired Former Ace Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Velourian Star (Medal)
    Other Notes: Acedom removed due to mishandling of delicate diplomatic
situation.
League:
* Alfred Wecksly: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Silver Coalition Command Flying Cross
* Nissi Valdaire: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: League Distinguished Flying Cross, Accord of Free Worlds
Meritorious Service Medal, Aria Star (Medal), Purple Heart (Medal)
Fringe:
* Cesar Ysidro: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Burlingame Siegebreaker (Medal)
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Participant in [CLASSIFIED] Experiment #009703: [CLASSIFIED].
* Darin Frost: Ace Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Blockade Runner/Smuggler
    Other Notes: Location unknown.
* Nick Enderton: Ace Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Location unknown.
* Rowan McKell: Former Veteran Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Demerited by Nina Thomas for repeatedly speaking ill of the
Confederation of Fringe Worlds.
* Scott Hawkins: Former Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Former member of the Fringe Navy. Acedom removed, reasons
unknown.
* Tabi Canis: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Accord of Free Worlds Meritorious Service Medal
    Achievements: [3 CLASSIFIED ENTRIES], Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: [CLASSIFIED]
* Tony Matos: Retired Veteran Pilot
    Status: INACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of Chetumal
    Other Notes: Lost vision during the Battle of Chetumal, Participant in
Fringe Medical Experiment #001719: [CLASSIFIED]
Mutuality:
* Anfisa of Marzore: Veteran Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Notable Awards: Accord of Free Worlds Meritorious Service Medal, Aria Star
    Achievements: Defense of Sector -1: Renegade Fleet Command Center
    Other Notes: Member of unreg subfactions: Renegade, Marzore Clan, Shade
Clan, Former name: Aradi.
* Dylan Sparks: Ace Pilot
    Status: ACTIVE
    Achievements: Defense of New Beginning
    Other Notes: Member of unreg subfaction: Renegade. Custom made. Location
known.
--

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top, a pair of mystic
purple suede clogs, a stretchy long-sleeved light purple top with a brightly
colored star print, a pair of tight white denim jeans with a small dark-red 'XX'
embroidered on the back left pocket, a lilac satin push-up bra, and a pair of
soft lilac satin bikini panties here.
Lily Kaise is lying on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.

Teslatown activities, very inexperienced with belt management, very
inexperienced with salvages, very inexperienced with deliveries, very
inexperienced with asteroid mining, very inexperienced with passengers, very
inexperienced with atmospheric scooping, very inexperienced with salvage
operations, and very inexperienced with trading.
Related to starship combat, you are the best at combat gunning, good with
mission-related ship kills, good at combat piloting, very inexperienced at
advanced engineering techniques, very inexperienced with minor skirmish ship
kills, very inexperienced at defending salvage operations, and very
inexperienced with invading ship kills.
Related to ground combat, you are good with weapon hits, inexperienced with
kills, and very inexperienced with ground missions.
Related to exploration, you are the best with planetary probes, good with deep
space probes, inexperienced with planetary finds, inexperienced at analyzing
deep space finds, inexperienced at the exploration of the Glyphmaker ruins,
inexperienced with space imaging, inexperienced with local artifact finds,
inexperienced with alien artifact finds, and very inexperienced with assisted
planetary finds.
l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.

Flight Control: Flight control in New Earth here, an AEU destroyer is outbound.
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
%R<Km<{z~U|L`Dlj)H//:xbAN2]P/Q[o@P+Rc6M:
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.

sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
(You are sitting on a black leather captain's chair.)

I don't understand that.

The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
(You are sitting on a black leather captain's chair.)
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
[0m[Miriani] The mild vibration of acceleration eases off and is replaced by the
firm pull of gravity as the ship touches down smoothly on the planet's surface.[0m

[Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad]
Carved out of the top of one of the old mountains north of Chetumal City, the
landing pad of this spaceport has an unmatched panoramic view of the
countryside. A low cliff shelters it on the north side, with mail, security, and
repair facilities built into it, and recent construction efforts have expanded
the area and given it a sleek new look. The pad itself consists of a patchwork
of heavy plasteel panels bordered by beams of lighted steel, the panels
variously sized to accommodate any model of starship, no matter how large or
small. A modern but somewhat noisy hydraulic system moves starships between the
landing pad and the garage below. On the south side of the pad is the pilot
lounge with large, tinted windows overlooking the fine Chetumalian landscape to
the south. You can GO into its sleek glass-framed doorway. There is also a
doorway here marked 'Liaison Office,' which you can also GO into. A doorway to
the south leads to the Salvage Reclamation Project Center, and a wide metal
stairway leads down into lower levels of the spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The five-person mass production scythe "Cleopatra" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a long row of cinder blocks, a trash can,
and Vim the mound of parking tickets here.
Caleb Davenport and Alko Delovega are standing here.

[Starship "Cleopatra"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is at Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad.

i
 You are wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee with a large white lightning bolt
appliqued on the front, a pair of blue corduroy jeans, and a pair of gray canvas
sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a
pair of white socks. You are also wearing a keychain, a backpack, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing
a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a metallic silver
metachannel FTL communicator, a leather briefcase, a flight control scanner, a
large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched metal thigh holster,
a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets,
a camera bag, and a black engineering tool case. Your head, face, both eyes,
neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.
l
[Starship "Cleopatra"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is at The Torus; Dock Alpha.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go north and south.
(You are sitting.)

[Starship "Sphinx"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is at Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad.

Hakeem Oiadip absently bobs his head up and down like a space parakeet.
Katina Faye laughs at you.
The ship's computer automatically requests landing clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Stormy Skies. We read your
Fringe transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of Chetumal City."
[Notification from Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] The organization has
received 168,866.81 EAOS credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating
Solar Toll Station in The Belt of Orion.
chuckle
You chuckle.
With everything arranged, you settle into the damage control station.
Hakeem Oiadip speaks into his charred metachannel FTL communicator:
[General Communication] Hakeem Oiadip transmits, "Where I meet you Mel, Earth?"
Hakeem Oiadip pulls a large lever towards him.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
You follow Hakeem Oiadip out.
[Starship "Stormy Skies"; Airlock]
Hakeem Oiadip is standing here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
You follow Hakeem Oiadip out of the ship.
[Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad]
The scout "White Eagle" and the three-person flying wing "Stormy Skies" are
landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a long row of cinder blocks, a trash can,
and Vim the mound of parking tickets here.
Hakeem Oiadip is standing here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and down.
The five-person mass production scythe "Stormbringer" is slowly brought in
aboard an automated flatbed, then lowered to the floor.
You follow Hakeem Oiadip aboard the five-person mass production scythe
"Stormbringer".
[Starship "Stormbringer"; Airlock]
You see a personal hoverpallet here.
Hakeem Oiadip is standing here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
You follow Hakeem Oiadip into the ship.
[Starship "Stormbringer"; Control Room]
You see a decoy beacon launcher and a dark purple leather captain's chair here.
Hakeem Oiadip is standing here.
You can go south and out.
Hakeem Oiadip grasps a large lever on the control board and pushes it slowly
away from him.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
Hakeem Oiadip uses the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
Hakeem Oiadip removes a secondary pilot command access unit from a dark green
canvas backpack.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Stormbringer, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
Hakeem Oiadip says, "Now you guys are free from me."
'Head out to 285
You say, "Head out to 285."
Hakeem Oiadip nods.
'She'll meet us out there.
You say, "She'll meet us out there."
s
Hakeem Oiadip presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.

tra gen He already kidnapped us.
[General Communication] Shule Elemmire transmits, "He already kidnapped us."
peer n
You peer north...
[Starship "Stormbringer"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher and a dark purple leather captain's chair here.
Hakeem Oiadip and Katina Faye are standing here.
You can go south and out.
[Tactical Communication] Hakeem Oiadip transmits, "Pirates interdicting orion."

repair 10
Syntax:
  REPAIR <component>
  Such as: repair hull
  Or:      repair launcher 2
  Or:      repair stop
Valid components are: hull, sensors, FTL, launcher, turret, or STOP

[Notification from Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] The organization has
received 168,866.81 EAOS credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating
Solar Toll Station in The Belt of Orion.
The ship is suddenly grasped by powerful EMMs from a nearby temporary space
station.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
[Tactical Communication] Hakeem Oiadip transmits, "In the flow."
[Tactical Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "ETA?"
[Tactical Communication] Hakeem Oiadip transmits, "Eta 7."
The mist turns to black smoke that soon drifts away, and you find that the ship
is on a conveyor belt, moving rapidly through a factory.
Small clinks of metal come from the hull of the ship as it's being repaired.
With everything arranged, you settle into the damage control station.

l
[Starship "Stormbringer"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is at League Repairing Battery-Powered Long-Range Watchtower; Docking Bay.
You see a dark purple leather captain's chair here.
You can go north and south.
[Salvage Op] Hakeem Oiadip: "Thanks people."

diligently on the outside of the starship.

completed by the spaceport."

[Starship "Stormbringer"; Weapons Room Two]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is inside the riftflow.

[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,
another sign reads 'Spaceport Exit and Express Train.'
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The two-person Accord gemini "Gtr Beni Gittiin Yere" and the five-person mass
production scythe "Stormbringer" are landed here.
You see an asteroid-shaped steel trash bin here.
You can go north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest,
and down.
out
You exit the ship.

This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.

l mini
a miniature AEU Soothsayer cruiser [inside a leather briefcase]
This tiny starship measures approximately 2.2 inches in length and is fashioned
to resemble the famous and fearsome AEU cruiser, the Soothsayer, down to the
smallest detail. Its shiny dark green hull is blocky, with silver trim around
the twenty-five laser turrets and three plasma minicannon launchers. Near the
front of the ship is a viewport where a tiny pilot sits. Along its hull, written
in miniscule silver block letters, is the designation 'AH-12.'

l
[Starship "Revenge"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive, a dark gray leather captain's
chair, and a decoy beacon launcher here.
You can go down and out.

 You are wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee with a large white lightning bolt
appliqued on the front, a pair of blue corduroy jeans, and a pair of gray canvas
sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a
pair of white socks. You are also wearing a keychain, a backpack, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing
a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a metallic silver
metachannel FTL communicator, a leather briefcase, a flight control scanner, a
large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched metal thigh holster,
a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets,
a camera bag, and a black engineering tool case. Your head, face, both eyes,
neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

[Starship "Revenge"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive, a dark gray leather captain's
chair, and a decoy beacon launcher here.
You can go down and out.

[Starship "Revenge"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive, a dark gray leather captain's
chair, and a decoy beacon launcher here.
You can go down and out.

where
Your communicator reports that...
At least three recently active pilots are relaxing at Manhattan Spaceport; Pilot
Lounge.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl old earth
The ship is already moving.
ftl old earth
sit chair
You sit down on a black leather captain's chair.
Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.

Uncharted Sector (EAOS) [Human Interalliance Space] (Security: Gamma-1)
Coordinate rundown:

l
[Starship "Praying Mantis"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a gray leather
captain's chair, and a large leather couch here.
Katina Faye is sitting on a large leather couch. Marion Fabre is standing here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a large leather couch.)

[Starship "Praying Mantis"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a gray leather
captain's chair, and a large leather couch here.
Katina Faye is sitting on a large leather couch.
You can go south and out.
[PA] Katina Faye: "Shule?"

[Starship "Praying Mantis"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
Purr the humanoid service robot, and Prissy the big violet long-haired felo
here.
Lily Kaise is sleeping on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
Prissy the big violet long-haired felo rears up and plants both pairs of
forelegs on your leg, then rubs its head against you, purring softly.
A large thickly-shelled creature with a red shell and four small claws grips a
plastic wrecked EAOS Defender firmly in its claws, then gives up when it can't
break the toy.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
Lily Kaise is sleeping on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[MTTS] Squidmind: Headlines come from different things. Player actions, yes, of
course. We'd like to do more positive headlines in that respect, but positive
proactive things tend to be rare and the negative naturally weighs more heavily
in the human brain anyway. Some are spoofing current events. And some are made
to move plotlines forward in a sort of background manner. Sometimes we post them
instantly, but we can also queue them for any future time.
[MTTS] Ulias: There being less poitive ones kinda makes sense too though. In the
real world the good things are often ignored by the news.
[MTTS] Ulias: Positive.

[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
read letter
--
Lily,
This isn't widely-known yet, but Eve and I are planning on putting the
out-of-comms asteroid processor at 288 back up sometime in the next couple of
days, given the fact that most people seem to finally be home for a while to use
it. And since you were on it before, and have also been willing to consistently
keep me on the one at 285, I wanted to return the favor. If you can stick a
reactor, or else a basic top or sheathing, on the ship corresponding to the key
here in the package, I'll see to it that you guys are there. My only request is
that this be from your org directly, not a Starseekers part, as due to Kim's
present stance on 777 and being unwilling to provide inserters for it, I'm
currently not inclined to include them. The reactor would be preferred, but if
you'd rather not spring for that much, either of the other two parts will be
fine, just try to have whichever of them there within the next day or so if at
all possible.
Thanks.
--
Nicolette
--
Lily Kaise says, "Just so we're on the same page."

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
Purr the humanoid service robot, Shasta the old big onyx soldier felo, and
Cheri-Pye the large light violet felo here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

and sapphire star quilt on it.)

hand, looking up at her adoringly.

hand, looking up at her adoringly.

[Starship "Praying Mantis"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, a gray leather
captain's chair, a large leather couch, and a long white faerie dress made of
layers of sheer gauzy silk here.
You can go south and out.

[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
Even though this starship garage smells like machine oil and heavy lubricants,
it is spacious and well-lit. Massive hydraulic systems raise and lower starships
to and from the landing pad above, and technicians and mechanics in silvery gray
coveralls ensure that everything keeps running smoothly. A well-lit stairway
which leads to the pilot's lounge is here.

l soldier
a large red soldier felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely wolf-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped red fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, curved white claws,
visible only when not retracted. A grey, Bari nose sits below a pair of clear
blue eyes with vertical pupils.
l second soldier
a big red soldier felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely wolf-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped red fur,
possessing a short, thin tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
average-length, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, curved white
claws, visible only when not retracted. A grey, diamond nose sits below a pair
of clear blue eyes with vertical pupils.
l third soldier
a sleeping hefty white soldier felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely wolf-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped white fur,
possessing a short, thin tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, curved white claws,
visible only when not retracted. A white, Bari nose sits below a pair of clear
blue eyes with vertical pupils. It appears to be sleeping.
l fourth soldier
an old large red soldier felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely wolf-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped red fur,
possessing a short, thin tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with average, curved white claws,
visible only when not retracted. A white, vertical nose sits below a pair of
clear blue eyes with vertical pupils.

l fifth soldier
an obese light red soldier felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely wolf-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped light red fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, curved white claws,
visible only when not retracted. A grey, square nose sits below a pair of clear
blue eyes with vertical pupils.
l sixth soldier
an obese light red soldier felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely wolf-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped light red fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, curved white claws,
visible only when not retracted. A grey, square nose sits below a pair of clear
blue eyes with vertical pupils.
l kitten
an obese red felo kitten
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely cat-like, though its head appears
rather vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped red fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with thin, curved white claws
visible. A white, vertical nose sits below a pair of clear blue eyes with
vertical pupils. Around its neck and across its first set of shoulders is an
impressive red mane.

A big red felo seems to be hungry.
A big red felo approaches a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, glances
around, then begins shoveling low-grade dry Felo Chow into its mouth.
An old large red soldier felo lies down and curls up into a tight ball, closes
its eyes, and appears to sleep.
A large red soldier felo seems to be hungry.
A large red soldier felo approaches a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl,
glances around, then begins shoveling low-grade dry Felo Chow into its mouth.
An obese light red soldier felo marches west.
An old big red soldier felo marches in from the east.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

ftl hyperion
A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.
[Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] Lily Kaise transmits, "Wow another manded
one?"
Hyperion's famous Sea of Grass is immediately obvious upon gazing at the planet,
the rolling, meters-deep expanse of tall grasses obscuring the contours of the
surface.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Hyperion in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
tra org Yeah

Welcome to home space!"

ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

l
[Starship "Starlight Express"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a glossy pearl gray ceramic felo chow bowl, Mekensie the humanoid
service robot, an old large red soldier felo, and a big red felo here.
You can go south and out.
l red felo
a big red felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely cat-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size, and covered in short, striped red fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
average-length, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with average, curved
white claws visible. A white, helical nose sits below a pair of clear blue eyes
with vertical pupils. It appears to be somewhat unsteady on its paws.

[Starship "Starlight Express"; Living Quarters Block]
This room leads to the living quarters, and contains some additional amenities,
notably a tiny alcove containing a shower. A small keypad controls access to the
living quarters. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

[Starship "Starlight Express"; Living Quarters One]
You see a long plasteel counter, a pair of narrow bunks, a glossy purple ceramic
felo chow bowl, a felo nest, an old hefty light red felo, a big red soldier
felo, and an obese light red felo here.
You can go out.
l second felo
a felo nest
This large, pulsing striped light red mass is a felo nest, both birthplace and
home to future felo. The nest is shaped like a half-sphere, with the faint
imprint of a short, thin tail and short, thick legs remaining as evidence that
the nest was once actually a felo itself. Littered on the ground around it are a
few average white claws, shed in the metamorphosis.
l third felo
an old hefty light red felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely cat-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size, and covered in short, striped light red
fur, possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The
felo's short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with average, curved white
claws visible. A white, Bari nose sits below a pair of clear blue eyes with
vertical pupils. It appears to be somewhat unsteady on its paws.
l fourth felo
a big red soldier felo

almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped red fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, curved white claws,
visible only when not retracted. A black, Bari nose sits below a pair of clear
blue eyes with vertical pupils.

[Starship "Starlight Express"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a long plasteel counter, a pair of narrow bunks, a glossy purple ceramic
felo chow bowl, a felo nest, an old hefty light red felo, a big red soldier
felo, and an obese light red felo here.
You can go out.

almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped red fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with average, curved white claws,
visible only when not retracted. A white, vertical nose sits below a pair of
clear blue eyes with vertical pupils. It appears to be sleeping.
out

[Starship "Starlight Express"; Living Quarters Two]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a long plasteel counter, a pair of narrow bunks, and a glossy sea green
ceramic felo chow bowl here.

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Starlight Express, you have clearance
to launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl hyperion
The ship is already moving.
ftl hyperion
A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.
Hyperion's famous Sea of Grass is immediately obvious upon gazing at the planet,
the rolling, meters-deep expanse of tall grasses obscuring the contours of the
surface.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Hyperion in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order
is entered."
move
AutoStar detects 4 possible destinations.  Assembling destination list.  Please
wait.
--
AutoStar (general-purpose starship autopilot) Version 9.1
--
Destinations in this sector:
   Planets:
[1] Hyperion                                                
   Space Stations:
[2] Space Station Alpha                                     
   Ships (present location):
[3] AEU Navy Honour Guard Scout Tau-4                       
[4] AEU Navy Honour Guard Scout Delta-9                     
--
Enter your destination:
1
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Hyperion.
Via general sector communication, Hyperion transmits, "Hello there, Starlight
Express! Welcome to home space!"
eta
The ship's current engine speed is 6857 km/s.
At that speed, the ship will arrive at its current autopilot destination in
about 10.5 seconds.
The ship's computer automatically requests landing clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Starlight Express. We read your
AEU transponder. You are cleared to land."
who tamra
Tamra Swenson does not seem to have an active communicator.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
l
[Starship "Starlight Express"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Hyperion; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a glossy pearl gray ceramic felo chow bowl, Mekensie the humanoid
service robot, and a big red felo here.
You can go south and out.
l red felo
a big red felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely cat-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size, and covered in short, striped red fur,
possessing a short, sleek tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
average-length, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with average, curved
white claws visible. A white, helical nose sits below a pair of clear blue eyes
with vertical pupils. It appears to be somewhat unsteady on its paws.

[Starship "Starlight Express"; Main Deck]

l second felo
a felo nest
This large, pulsing striped red mass is a felo nest, both birthplace and home to
future felo. The nest is shaped like a half-sphere, with the faint imprint of a
short, sleek tail and short, thick legs remaining as evidence that the nest was
once actually a felo itself. Littered on the ground around it are a few thick
white claws, shed in the metamorphosis.
l third felo
a sleeping hefty white soldier felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely wolf-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped white fur,
possessing a short, thin tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
short, thick legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, curved white claws,
visible only when not retracted. A white, Bari nose sits below a pair of clear
blue eyes with vertical pupils. It appears to be sleeping.
An old large red soldier felo suddenly rushes up.
A hefty red soldier felo kitten marches in from above.

visible only when not retracted. A grey, square nose sits below a pair of clear
blue eyes with vertical pupils.

l
[Starship "Starlight Express"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is at Hyperion; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a glossy black ceramic felo chow bowl and an old big red soldier felo
here.
You can go north and south.

[Starship "Starlight Express"; Head]

not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you cannot see anything
because they are frosted for your privacy.

[Starship "Starlight Express"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at Hyperion; Spaceport
Landing Pad.

[Hyperion; Sea of Grass Road]
Gentle winds blow the high grasses back and forth, occasionally strongly enough
to push it into your path. The road is in obvious bad repair, but you don't pay
it much mind, keeping your eyes on the horizon. Faint sounds of animal life can
be heard over the wind. On the west side of the road the grass has been
trampled, and you can see a faint trail leading from here through the grassy
countryside. In addition, a bright red and white sign on the other side of the
road points the way down a clear path to the Felo Sanctuary to the east.
You can go north, east, and south.

FTL Interalliance Communications Network
--
Subject: Asteroid Processor Gamma 288
Author: Nicolette Lawrence
Posted: 01:57 29 June 2317 GST
--
A few people have been asking about this lately, so after several months of not
being there, due to various rift trips keeping a lot of people away from home
and other factors, I have put the out-of-comms asteroid processor back in place,
in its usual location, east of the radio bubble. There are a few caveats,
however.
First, you will need the communications range safety override upgrade on your
asteroid hauler to be able to make effective use of the processor. Second, the
ship will also need a rift drive, as there is no inserter to or from it. Also,
please note that there is no station with autonav out there, so be mindful of
that and ready to land once your ship enters the sector, or risk possible
problems. And finally, there is a 7.5 million EAOS credit toll for the trip back
home. All of these factors have been the case for quite some time, I'm just
going over them here for the benefit of newer pilots, and as a refresher course
for everyone else, since it's been a while.
To get to Asteroid Processor Gamma 288, simply jump to 287 from The Belt of
Orion, and then to 288 from there. You might want to trim back on the rift drive
just a bit for the first few seconds of the trip out, to decrease the chances of
being inadvertently pulled out into the radio bubble, although the chances of
this happening seem to vary somewhat, and there doesn't appear to be any
accurate way of predicting it in any case.
Happy hauling!
--
[1] Previous
[2] Return
[3] Reply
[4] Quit

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top, a pair of mystic
purple suede clogs, a stretchy long-sleeved light purple top with a brightly
colored star print, a pair of tight white denim jeans with a small dark-red 'XX'
embroidered on the back left pocket, a lilac satin push-up bra, and a pair of
soft lilac satin bikini panties here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.

and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

start

skin. You feel cleaner already.
get vinyl
You already have a small black vinyl case.

it invigorates your senses.
get last soap

case.
use soap

put soap in vinyl
You put a bar of clean-smelling light green soap in a small black vinyl case.
stop
You push a small button, turning the shower off. You stand, dripping, completely
relaxed. Steam floats lazily in the enclosed space.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The one-person cargo hauler "The Gimbled Ghost" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
d
[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
You can go up.
enter dove
[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, an
early warning space defense device, a glossy sky blue ceramic felo chow bowl,
and KitCat the humanoid service robot here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
enter dove
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
Purr the humanoid service robot, and Prissy the big violet long-haired felo
here.
You can go south and out.
sit couch

sapphire star quilt on it.

a new notice.
Lily Kaise grasps a large lever on the control board and pushes it slowly away
from her.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
Lily Kaise uses the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "William Dove, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
Once a valuable source for raw materials on the edge of Known Space, this area
is now fully mapped and lined with beacons.
Dark asteroids tumble lazily through the emptiness of space.
Via general sector communication, Old Frontier Processor transmits, "Hello
there, William Dove! Welcome to home space!"
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Old Frontier Processor.
Lily Kaise presses a button, calling up the coordinate rundown, and studies it
for a moment.
Lily Kaise presses a button to cancel the current autopilot program.
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Debris (nearest).
Lily Kaise activates the expert salvage electromagnetic manipulator and begins
scanning for debris.
A bit of debris is snagged by the starship's electromagnetic field projector and
slowly brought into the ship's hold.
The debris is now secured in the ship's hold.  Scanning reveals it to be some
starship debris.
There is no more nearby debris.
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: Old Frontier Processor.
Lily Kaise presses a button, calling up a display of the contents of the ship's
hold.

[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

both hands are left uncovered.

[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,
another sign reads 'Spaceport Exit and Express Train.'
There appear to be some people in the lounge.
The two-person light transport "Chained To The Rhythm", the five-person gunship
"Oh Lordy, The Lasers!", the five-person strike gunboat "Morning Dove", and the
five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" are landed here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor

drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and

glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white

sit couch

Lily Kaise sits down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made
white and sapphire star quilt on it.
Lily Kaise grasps a large lever on the control board and pushes it slowly away
from her.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.

for a moment.
rd
Frontier Cluster (AEU) [Human Interalliance Space] (Security: Beta-5)
Coordinate rundown:
Starships: William Dove (M) at (18, 2, 9)
Space Stations: (19, 2, 8)
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, William
Dove! Welcome to home space!"
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
