get paper from bin
You remove a fine piece of paper with an official header reading "From the
founder of Space Explorers Amidst The Stars" from a mail bin with "Shule
Elemmire" printed on the side.
read paper
--
Hello Constantine,
Hope all is going well with you and that you've had a nice break
from work ... or well I don't really consider piloting to be hard
work except when face to face with a big Rapid Assault!
I just wanted to let you know that we're still very eager to have
you join SEAS. I also want to emphasize that we are a full
facility organization with a well-equipped fleet of starships to
rent as well as we have two cruisers which are supported.
There is no requirement of you to contribute earned Points or
Credits. All contributions are voluntary as our primary goal is to
help you to develop to your fullest potential. At some point when
you feel that you would like to contribute towards organizational
goals, you would be welcomed to but never required unless there was
some unforeseen circumstance which depleted our resources. So far
though, SEAS has nearly 30 billion of available credits plus ample
balances in support and insurance funds. Shule and I have put a
lot of effort towards building up SEAS so that we could help
motivated newer pilots such as yourself. The only exception would
be that when you become Cruiser qualified and SEAS takes on the
responsibility to support your Cruiser, then we would appreciate
credits contributed towards its support. We still want to assure
that the Corps has enough Cruisers to aid in the defense of
humanity so provided you are an active member, if your income level
is still insufficient to contribute, unless SEAS budget could not
sustain your Cruiser, then we would waive the credits contribution
requirement.
Last, we are selective in who we will choose to recruit as members.
Although we enjoy socializing, we are focused and serious about
our work. We want our members to represent strong ethical values
as well. Shule and I have been observing your progress and we
believe that you represent these core values.
We will look forward to the opportunity to add you as a member of
SEAS.
Kind regards
Lily Kaise
--

of Space Explorers Amidst The Stars" in a leather briefcase.

--
Hello Ryo,
Over the past few weeks, Shule and I, who are the founders of Space
Explorers Amidst the Stars (SEAS), have observed your progress as a
new pilot. We want to express to you that we are pleased with what
we've observed and proud that you have chosen to become a pilot
amongst our fine Corps.
If you are interested in joining an organization, at some point
when it is convenient, we would appreciate the opportunity to meet
with you to discuss SEAS with you and how the organization may
enhance your growth and development as a pilot.
We look forward to hearing from you.
Kind regards,
Lily Kaise

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

and sapphire star quilt on it.)

lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
sit couch
You sit down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it.
A short amethyst soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles abruptly
flings itself at the side of the tank, its tentacles tapping at the glass, then
it withdraws.

whole.

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, William
Dove! Welcome to home space!"
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
A long amber soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles rears up
suddenly from behind a plastic wrecked EAOS Defender and wraps its tentacles
around it as if trying to drag it into the deep.
The ship's computer automatically requests landing clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, William Dove. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
Lily Kaise pulls a large lever towards her.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.

[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
read comm
You glance at your communicator's screen.
Notice from the Voice of the Corps: Hi all, 2 things. I have learned from the
Liaison office that Mr. Lambeth will plan to attend our meeting tomorrow
evening, July 1st at 23:30, to be held in the conference room on New Earth.
Secondly, this is maybe not really my job, although safety of our ships and the
spaceport concerns us all. It concerns the one-person cargo hauler The
GimbleGhost, which has been sitting on the landing pad all powered up for
several days. To whomever owns it, will you please power it down and check that
there are no bari aboard your ship. Should you need assistance in dealing with
bari, I am sure someone will be glad to help. This is also a call out to all our
new pilots who may not be aware, after you land somewhere, please power down
your ship. I suppose the only exceptions are if you are immediately going to
launch again, or if you have ordered a repair, but when you are not using a
ship, it should be powered down and preferably safe in the garage. Considering
the risk a powered up ship poses not only to itself, but to all other ships on
the landing pad, I will now have no choice but to inform the liaison office,
they might need to send someone to take care of the matter. Thank you for your
attention and see you all tomorrow evening if not before. [08:49 30 June 2317
GST]
A large semi-transparent bell-shaped creature with long dangling tendrils and a
fuchsia glowing interior drifts slowly past a plastic shipwreck flying a pirate
flag.
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

A firmly rooted animal with dozens of rough green tendrils slowly waves its many

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
